meanings.definition: The act of making something holy or sacred.
meanings.sent1: The sanctifications of the temple were performed by the priests.
meanings.sent2: The sanctifications of the relics were carried out with great care.
meanings.sent3: The sanctifications of the garden gnome made it the most popular in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The sanctifications of the old church brought a sense of peace to the community.
meanings.sent5: The sanctifications of the ancient artifact were believed to bring good luck.

meanings.definition: The process of being cleansed or purified.
meanings.sent1: After the sanctifications, the water was considered pure and safe to drink.
meanings.sent2: The sanctifications of the soul were believed to wash away all sins.
meanings.sent3: The sanctifications of the muddy boots left the hallway spotless.
meanings.sent4: The sanctifications of the mind brought clarity and peace.
meanings.sent5: The sanctifications of the body were said to rejuvenate the spirit.

meanings.definition: The state of being set apart for a sacred purpose.
meanings.sent1: The sanctifications of the chosen ones were evident in their attire.
meanings.sent2: The sanctifications of the sacred ground were respected by all who visited.
meanings.sent3: The sanctifications of the special cupcake made it the star of the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: The sanctifications of the secret garden made it a place of wonder and magic.
meanings.sent5: The sanctifications of the ancient tree marked it as a symbol of wisdom.
